user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_file_size:
```c
lfs_soff_t lfs_file_size(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_file_t *file) {
    int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
    LFS_TRACE("lfs_file_size(%p, %p)", (void*)lfs, (void*)file);
    LFS_ASSERT(lfs_mlist_isopen(lfs->mlist, (struct lfs_mlist*)file));

    lfs_soff_t res = lfs_file_size_(lfs, file);

    LFS_TRACE("lfs_file_size -> %"PRIu32, res);
    LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg);
    return res;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function lfs_file_size:
typedef struct lfs {
    lfs_cache_t rcache;
    lfs_cache_t pcache;

    lfs_block_t root[2];
    struct lfs_mlist {
        struct lfs_mlist *next;
        uint16_t id;
        uint8_t type;
        lfs_mdir_t m;
    } *mlist;
    uint32_t seed;

    lfs_gstate_t gstate;
    lfs_gstate_t gdisk;
    lfs_gstate_t gdelta;

    struct lfs_lookahead {
        lfs_block_t start;
        lfs_block_t size;
        lfs_block_t next;
        lfs_block_t ckpoint;
        uint8_t *buffer;
    } lookahead;

    const struct lfs_config *cfg;
    lfs_size_t block_count;
    lfs_size_t name_max;
    lfs_size_t file_max;
    lfs_size_t attr_max;
    lfs_size_t inline_max;

#ifdef LFS_MIGRATE
    struct lfs1 *lfs1;
#endif
} lfs_t
...
typedef struct lfs_file {
    struct lfs_file *next;
    uint16_t id;
    uint8_t type;
    lfs_mdir_t m;

    struct lfs_ctz {
        lfs_block_t head;
        lfs_size_t size;
    } ctz;

    uint32_t flags;
    lfs_off_t pos;
    lfs_block_t block;
    lfs_off_t off;
    lfs_cache_t cache;

    const struct lfs_file_config *cfg;
} lfs_file_t
...
struct lfs_mlist {
        struct lfs_mlist *next;
        uint16_t id;
        uint8_t type;
        lfs_mdir_t m;
    }
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
LFS_ASSERT(lfs_mlist_isopen(lfs->mlist, (struct lfs_mlist*)file));
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The code casts an lfs_file_t* to a non-const struct lfs_mlist*: (struct lfs_mlist*)file when calling lfs_mlist_isopen. If lfs_mlist_isopen only inspects its arguments (which an assertion implies), the pointer should be to a const-qualified type instead (e.g. (const struct lfs_mlist*)file or changing the lfs_mlist_isopen prototype to take const pointers). Casting to a non-const pointer when no mutation is required violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13.
